57 class StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainerBase {
58 public:
59 
61  typedef Teuchos_Ordinal Ordinal;
62 
64  static Ordinal getInvalidOrdinal() { return -1; }
65 
66 public: // Public members (but only for unit testing purposes!)
67 
71  class OrdinalIndex {
72  public:
74  typedef StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainerBase::Ordinal Ordinal;
76  Ordinal idx;
78  OrdinalIndex()
79  : idx(StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainerBase::getInvalidOrdinal())
80  {}
82  OrdinalIndex(const Ordinal idx_in)
83  : idx(idx_in)
84  {}
85  };

100  template<class ObjType>
101  class KeyObjectPair {
102  public:
104  const std::string &first;
106  ObjType second;
108  std::string key;
110  KeyObjectPair() : first(key), second(ObjType()), key(""), isActive_(true) {}
112  KeyObjectPair(const std::string &key_in, const ObjType &obj_in, bool isActive_in = true)
113  : first(key), second(obj_in), key(key_in), isActive_(isActive_in) {}
115  KeyObjectPair(const KeyObjectPair<ObjType> &kop)
116  : first(key), second(kop.second), key(kop.key), isActive_(kop.isActive_) {}
118  KeyObjectPair<ObjType>& operator=(const KeyObjectPair<ObjType> &kop)
119  {
120  second = kop.second;
121  key = kop.key;
122  isActive_ = kop.isActive_;
123  return *this;
124  }
126  static KeyObjectPair<ObjType> makeInvalid()
127  { return KeyObjectPair("", ObjType(), false); }
129  bool isActive() const { return isActive_; }
130  private:
131  bool isActive_;
132  };
133 
135  template<class ObjType>
136  class SelectActive {
137  public:
138  bool operator()(const KeyObjectPair<ObjType> &key_and_obj) const
139  { return key_and_obj.isActive(); }
140  };
141 
143  class InvalidOrdinalIndexError : public ExceptionBase
144  {public:InvalidOrdinalIndexError(const std::string& what_arg) : ExceptionBase(what_arg) {}};
145 
147  class InvalidKeyError : public ExceptionBase
148  {public:InvalidKeyError(const std::string& what_arg) : ExceptionBase(what_arg) {}};
149 
150 };

174 template<class ObjType>
175 class StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer
176  : private StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainerBase
177 {
178 private:
179 
181  typedef KeyObjectPair<ObjType> key_and_obj_t;
183  typedef std::deque<key_and_obj_t> key_and_obj_array_t; // See notes below!
185  typedef std::map<std::string, OrdinalIndex> key_to_idx_map_t;
186 
187 public:
188 
191 
193  typedef StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainerBase::Ordinal Ordinal;
194 
196  typedef FilteredIterator<typename key_and_obj_array_t::iterator, SelectActive<ObjType> >
197  Iterator;
198 
200  typedef FilteredIterator<typename key_and_obj_array_t::const_iterator, SelectActive<ObjType> >
201  ConstIterator;
202 
204 
207 
209  StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer();
210 
212  Ordinal numObjects() const;
213 
215  Ordinal numStorage() const;
216 
218 
221 
230  Ordinal setObj(const std::string &key, const ObjType &obj);
231 
236  inline Ordinal getObjOrdinalIndex(const std::string &key) const;
237 
241  inline Ptr<ObjType> getNonconstObjPtr(const Ordinal &idx);
242 
246  inline Ptr<const ObjType> getObjPtr(const Ordinal &idx) const;
247 
251  inline Ptr<ObjType> getNonconstObjPtr(const std::string &key);
252 
256  inline Ptr<const ObjType> getObjPtr(const std::string &key) const;
257 
264  void removeObj(const Ordinal &idx);
265 
267  void removeObj(const std::string &key);
268 
270 
273 
275  inline Iterator nonconstBegin();
276 
278  inline Iterator nonconstEnd();
279 
281  inline ConstIterator begin() const;
282 
284  inline ConstIterator end() const;
285 
287 
288 private: // data members
289 
291  key_and_obj_array_t key_and_obj_array_;
293  key_to_idx_map_t key_to_idx_map_;
294 
295  // The above is a fairly simple data-structure.
296  //
297  // key_and_obj_array_: Array that stores the objects (and key names), by
298  // value, in the order they are inserted. Any removed objects will have the
299  // index valuie of getInvalidOrdinal(). The key strings are also storied
300  // with the objects so that a clean iterator can over the objects has access
301  // to both the key and the object value.
302  //
303  // key_to_idx_map_: Maps the unique string key to the unigue ordinal index
304  // for an object.
305  //
306  // NOTES:
307  //
308  // A) This data-structure stores the key names twice in order to allow for
309  // optimal iterator performance. The array key_and_obj_array_ allows fast
310  // ordered iterators through the data but in order to also provide the names
311  // in a fast manner, they have to be stored twice.
312  //
313  // B) Deleting objects is done by just removing an entry from
314  // key_to_idx_map_ but the corresponding entry in key_and_obj_array_ is just
315  // abandoned with the object value set to ObjType().
316 
317 private: // member functions
318 
320  void assertOrdinalIndex(const Ordinal idx) const;
321 
323  key_and_obj_t& getNonconstKeyAndObject(const Ordinal idx);
324 
326  const key_and_obj_t& getKeyAndObject(const Ordinal idx) const;
327 
329  void throwInvalidKeyError(const Ordinal idx, const std::string &key) const;
330 
332  Ordinal assertKeyGetOrdinal(const std::string &key) const;
333 
334 };
335 
336

339 //

345 template<class ObjType>
346 inline
347 Ptr<ObjType>
348 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::getNonconstObjPtr(const Ordinal &idx)
349 {
350  return ptrFromRef(getNonconstKeyAndObject(idx).second);
351 }
352 
353 
354 template<class ObjType>
355 inline
356 Ptr<const ObjType>
357 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::getObjPtr(const Ordinal &idx) const
358 {
359  return ptrFromRef(getKeyAndObject(idx).second);
360 }
361 
362 
363 template<class ObjType>
364 inline
365 Ptr<ObjType>
366 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::getNonconstObjPtr(const std::string &key)
367 {
368  return getNonconstObjPtr(assertKeyGetOrdinal(key));
369 }
370 
371 
372 template<class ObjType>
373 inline
374 Ptr<const ObjType>
375 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::getObjPtr(const std::string &key) const
376 {
377  return getObjPtr(assertKeyGetOrdinal(key));
378 }

384 template<class ObjType>
385 inline
386 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::Iterator
387 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::nonconstBegin()
388 {
389  return Iterator(key_and_obj_array_.begin(), key_and_obj_array_.begin(),
390  key_and_obj_array_.end());
391 }
392 
393 
394 template<class ObjType>
395 inline
396 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::Iterator
397 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::nonconstEnd()
398 {
399  return Iterator(key_and_obj_array_.end(), key_and_obj_array_.begin(),
400  key_and_obj_array_.end());
401 }
402 
403 
404 template<class ObjType>
405 inline
406 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::ConstIterator
407 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::begin() const
408 {
409  return ConstIterator(key_and_obj_array_.begin(), key_and_obj_array_.begin(),
410  key_and_obj_array_.end());
411 }
412 
413 
414 template<class ObjType>
415 inline
416 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::ConstIterator
417 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::end() const
418 {
419  return ConstIterator(key_and_obj_array_.end(), key_and_obj_array_.begin(),
420  key_and_obj_array_.end());
421 }

437 template<class ObjType>
438 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::Ordinal
439 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::numObjects() const
440 {
441  return key_to_idx_map_.size();
442 }
443 
444 
445 template<class ObjType>
446 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::Ordinal
447 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::numStorage() const
448 {
449  return key_and_obj_array_.size();
450 }
451 
452 
453 // Set, get, and remove functions
454 
455 
456 template<class ObjType>
457 inline
458 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::Ordinal
459 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::getObjOrdinalIndex(const std::string &key) const
460 {
461  key_to_idx_map_t::const_iterator itr = key_to_idx_map_.find(key);
462  if (itr != key_to_idx_map_.end()) {
463  return itr->second.idx;
464  }
465  return getInvalidOrdinal();
466 }
467 
468 
469 template<class ObjType>
470 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::Ordinal
471 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::setObj(const std::string &key,
472  const ObjType &obj)
473 {
474  typename key_to_idx_map_t::iterator obj_idx_itr = key_to_idx_map_.find(key);
475  if (obj_idx_itr != key_to_idx_map_.end()) {
476  // Object with the given key already exists
477  const Ordinal obj_idx = obj_idx_itr->second.idx;
478  key_and_obj_array_[obj_idx].second = obj;
479  return obj_idx;
480  }
481  // Object with the given key does not already exist so create a new one.
482  key_and_obj_array_.push_back(key_and_obj_t(key, obj));
483  const Ordinal new_idx = key_and_obj_array_.size()-1;
484  key_to_idx_map_[key] = new_idx;
485  return new_idx;
486 }
487 
488 
489 template<class ObjType>
490 void StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::removeObj(const Ordinal &idx)
491 {
492  key_and_obj_t &key_and_obj = getNonconstKeyAndObject(idx);
493  key_to_idx_map_.erase(key_and_obj.first);
494  key_and_obj = key_and_obj_t::makeInvalid();
495 }
496 
497 
498 template<class ObjType>
499 void StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::removeObj(const std::string &key)
500 {
501  typename key_to_idx_map_t::iterator itr = key_to_idx_map_.find(key);
502  if (itr == key_to_idx_map_.end()) {
503  throwInvalidKeyError(getInvalidOrdinal(), key);
504  }
505  const Ordinal idx = itr->second.idx;
506  key_to_idx_map_.erase(itr);
507  key_and_obj_array_[idx] = key_and_obj_t::makeInvalid();
508 }
509 
510 
511 // private
512 
513 
514 template<class ObjType>
515 void StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::assertOrdinalIndex(const Ordinal idx) const
516 {
517  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( !(0 <= idx && idx < numStorage()),
518  InvalidOrdinalIndexError,
519  "Error, the ordinal index " << idx << " is invalid"
520  << " because it falls outside of the range of valid objects"
521  << " [0,"<<numStorage()-1<<"]!");
522 }
523 
524 
525 template<class ObjType>
526 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::key_and_obj_t&
527 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::getNonconstKeyAndObject(const Ordinal idx)
528 {
529  assertOrdinalIndex(idx);
530  key_and_obj_t &key_and_obj = key_and_obj_array_[idx];
531  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( !key_and_obj.isActive(),
532  InvalidOrdinalIndexError,
533  "Error, the ordinal index " << idx << " is invalid"
534  << " because the object has been deleted!");
535  return key_and_obj;
536 }
537 
538 
539 template<class ObjType>
540 const typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::key_and_obj_t&
541 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::getKeyAndObject(const Ordinal idx) const
542 {
543  assertOrdinalIndex(idx);
544  const key_and_obj_t &key_and_obj = key_and_obj_array_[idx];
545  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( !key_and_obj.isActive(),
546  InvalidOrdinalIndexError,
547  "Error, the ordinal index " << idx << " is invalid"
548  << " because the object has been deleted!");
549  return key_and_obj;
550 }
551 
552 
553 template<class ObjType>
554 void
555 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::throwInvalidKeyError(
556  const Ordinal idx, const std::string &key) const
557 {
558  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( idx == getInvalidOrdinal(), InvalidKeyError,
559  "Error, the key '" << key << "' does not exist!");
560 }
561 
562 
563 template<class ObjType>
564 typename StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::Ordinal
565 StringIndexedOrderedValueObjectContainer<ObjType>::assertKeyGetOrdinal(const std::string &key) const
566 {
567  const Ordinal idx = getObjOrdinalIndex(key);
568  throwInvalidKeyError(idx, key);
569  return idx;
570 }
571 
572 
573 } // end of Teuchos namespace
574 
575 /* Notes:
576  *
577  * This class may have a bit of a fragile implemenation. It uses std::deque
578  * instead of std::vector to hold the stored objects. This is so that once an
579  * object is added, it will keep the exact same address no matter how many
580  * other objects are added. This is not the case with std::vector because
581  * when the memory is resized it will copy the value objects making the old
582  * objects invalid. My guess with the std::deque class is that it would
583  * allocate and store the chunks such that once an objects was added to a
584  * chunk that it would not get reallocated and moved like in std::vector. I
585  * don't feel very good about relying on this behavior but my guess is that
586  * this will be pretty portable. If this turns out not to be portable, we can
587  * always just use RCP<ObjType> to store the object and that will guarantee
588  * that the object address will never be moved. Going with an RCP<ObjType>
589  * implementation would also allow the Ptr<ObjType> views to catch dangling
590  * references in a debug-mode build.
591  */
592 
593 
594 #endif // TEUCHOS_STRING_INDEXED_ORDERED_VALUE_OBJECT_CONTAINER_HPP
